## Overview

Essential tools and setup for a complete Linux development environment.

---

## Quick Setup Script

```bash
# System update
sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade -y

# Essential tools
sudo apt install curl git -y

# C/C++ Development Tools
sudo apt install build-essential -y

# Java Development Kit
sudo apt install default-jdk -y
echo 'export JAVA_HOME="/usr/lib/jvm/default-java"' >> ~/.bashrc

# Python (UV), Node.js, Podman - See installation links below
# UV → https://docs.astral.sh/uv/#installation
# Node → https://nodejs.org/en/download
# Podman → https://podman.io/docs/installation

# Virtual Machine (KVM/QEMU)
sudo apt install qemu-kvm libvirt-daemon-system libvirt-clients bridge-utils virt-manager -y
sudo systemctl enable libvirtd && sudo systemctl start libvirtd
sudo usermod -aG libvirt,kvm $USER

# Restart to apply changes
sudo reboot
```

## Individual Tool Setup

### Git - Version Control

```bash
# Install Git
sudo apt install git -y

# Configure Git
git config --global user.name "Your Name"
git config --global user.email "your.email@example.com"
git config --global init.defaultBranch main

# Verify installation
git --version
```

> Question: How will i know where public key stored?  
> Ans: After running `ssh-keygen` you will see the public key location mentioned like  
> **Your public key has been saved in `<path>`**  
> Just copy the path and run `cat <path>`  

- Copy the public key, and paste it to your github account ssh
- `Settings -> (Access) SSH and GPG keys -> New SSH key`
- Note: `Key Type` should be `Authentication Type`
- Note: `Key` **should not have any extra spaces or new lines**

### Java Development Kit (JDK)

```bash
# Install default JDK
sudo apt install default-jdk -y

# Set JAVA_HOME environment variable
echo 'export JAVA_HOME="/usr/lib/jvm/default-java"' >> ~/.bashrc
source ~/.bashrc

# Verify installation
java -version
javac -version
```
